Clinton Van Arnam is a graphic designer and educator based in Brooklyn, NY. His design practice is characterized by a competency and abiding curiosity in emerging technologies. A student of process, Clinton embraces generative design methods with an emphasis on typographic detail.

Clinton currently teaches motion graphics and web interaction at Parsons School of Design. He holds a Bachelor of Arts from UCLA in Design Media Arts and a Master of Fine Arts from RISD in Graphic Design.

Clinton works with select clients on identity projects, web development, and motion graphics.

Email (work): cva@clintonvanarnam.net

Email (classes): vanarnac@newschool.edu
